snippet: The agreement includes civil penalties and stricter state standards on how toy guns look, which are intended to make them distinguishable from real guns.
abstract: Retailers including Walmart, Sears and Amazon reach settlement with New York Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman under which they will stop selling realistic-looking toy guns in state; will pay collective civil penalties of more than $300,000 for selling 6,400 such toys from 2012 to 2014.
lead_paragraph: The agreement includes civil penalties and stricter state standards on how toy guns look, which are intended to make them distinguishable from real guns.

headline.main: New York Reaches Accords With Sellers of Toy Guns
headline.print_headline: New York Reaches Accords With Sellers of Toy Guns
